info.name: Swagger Note API
info.description:
StartFragment

## Notes API Documentation

This API allows you to manage notes and organize them according to different categories.

StartFragment

```
Base URL: practice.expandtesting.com/notes/api 

 ```

EndFragmentStartFragment

EndFragmentStartFragment

## Features

- Create notes with title and content.
- Categorize notes into different categories.
- Update and delete notes.
- Search notes by title or category.
    

This API is also utilized as a backend for the [Notes App available here]().

EndFragment

StartFragment

## API Authorization Guide

To use this API, you must first have a valid account on the system and know your email and password. Once you have that information:

Log in to the API using the **login endpoint**. This will provide you with an authentication token that you can use to access the protected resources.

Keep the token safe, as you will need it for subsequent requests.

To authorize your requests, click the "**Authorize**" button on the top right corner of the Swagger UI interface. A dialog box will appear asking you to enter the authentication token.  
Enter the token you obtained from the login endpoint and click "**Authorize**".

You are now authorized to use all the protected API endpoints.

If you need help using this API, check out our **video guide and demo**, which are available [here]()

EndFragment

exec: pm.test("Response time is less than 1500ms", function(){
pm.test('Resonse body is in JSON', function(){
// store dynamic token value on environment variable with name 'tokenID'

request.description:
Login (POST): This is a positive scenerio where a user tries to login with correct credentials.

When a user logs in successfully, the server generates a dynamic token as part of the response body. However, this token changes each time the user logs out and logs back in. To handle this scenario, Ive written assertions in my test scripts. These assertions store the newly generated token in an environment variable named tokenID every time the user logs in again.
